dialogues.text: The Figure exits the car and stands on his toes to see through a locked fence gate and into the compound. He pic up a clipboard heavy with pages of scrawled notes. This is KENNETH CALLOWAY, 28. Not bad looking at all, but off. His hair, facial expressions, style, everything, just a bit off. A few nuc acid sequences away from being a happy human.  20. He jots down a note, nods with a serious determination th is slightly comical given his odd, mullet haircut, then g back into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track behind Kenneth pushing a pallet of detergent thr the lonely aisles of the 24 hour warehouse superstore. Darius appears from behind, discreetly trailing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth speaks to SHANNON, 63, an aging black man with a weary face, as they stock shelves. Darius pretends to bro nearby as she listens.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: The economy isn’t a fixed thing. People think because that’s how it is now then that’s how it’ll always be, but they’re just looking at this narrow band of time when if you look at the big picture the distribution of wealth has been steadily spreading out from aristocratic society to slave economy to industrial and on and on in both directions.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I gotta do a bathroom check, brother. To be continued.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. It’s just amazing how they can get these people to vote against their economic interests. Like it or not it’s historically headed in one direction, they're just delaying the inevitable. Kenneth continues stocking. Darius walks past and eyeball his name tag as he stretches to reach the high shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius approaches a SHIFT MANAGER, pen and card in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I wanted to fill out a comment card about one of your employees, Kenneth. What’s his last name?  21.

dialogues.speaker: SHIFT MANAGER
dialogues.text: Aw jeez, what’d he do? I apologize ma’am, he’s a little... The Shift Manager points at his head.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No. It’s a positive comment. Like complimenting him.

dialogues.speaker: SHIFT MANAGER
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh? Good. Kenneth Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Thank you. They look across the jewelry displays and spot Kenneth, w makes a dramatic spin, scoops up a stray can on the floor re-stocks it with an unusual amount of flair and purpose before continuing on with that oddly funny focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bar whose cheesy neon lights in tropical shapes a about half operational.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff drinks at the bar as he eyes the baby-faced COCKTAIL WAITRESS, 21, who serves the one occupied table in this b decorated with glowing palm trees and plastic torches. Arnau plays his on-line game on the laptop while sipping can of soda. Jeff looks over.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me with this? You said you needed to check your e- mail. And order a beer for God’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: I’m just seeing who’s online. Jeff pulls the laptop away. He sees an e-mail alert.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Jeff checks his e-mail. He clicks on a message that direc him to Facebook.com.  22.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Alllright. She accepted my friend request and she still lives here.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: (veading profile) Who's Liz Cleary?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: She was like the local chick I used to hang out with when my family came here. Summer lovin’. Fuck she was so tan and hot. And her hair was always bleached white from the sun. Man, if there’s one girl I always wondered about it’s her. Darius approaches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You creeps, drunk-stalking on Facebook at a bar.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Well there she is. Went all rogue, huh? What’d you get?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Got his name, where he works.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Nice. Good job. Tomorrow I’1l go in undercover, pretend to answer his ad, get the scoop on this yo-yo.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: (re: computer) What’d you get?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Basically he came here to hook up with a girl he knew when he was in high school.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Seriously? Jeff shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I'd be weirded out if some guy tracked me down after twenty years.  23.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I would be weirded out if some guy tracked you down too. Just knowing there’s a guy out there who would do that for you. Jeff sips his rum and cola.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (defensive) And it wasn’t twenty years. It was like thirteen. EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - DAY The Acura stops in front of a small house that must’ve on had great landscaping, which is now all dead and dried. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - SAME Darius has an open phone book on her lap. She reads the h number on the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: 991 Mallory. This is it. Jeff turns off the car and grabs the digital recorder.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Can I go in, too?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You did good last night but let’s let me handle this. I don’t want to overwhelm the guy. Jeff gets out and heads across the street. Darius and Arn watch through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: So, do you go out a lot back home, like clubs and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: You know those really tight leggings girls wear, do you wear -

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: There he is!  24. EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - SAME Kenneth exits a large shed beside the house and slides th doors to it shut. He then clamps shut a series of padlock INT. JEFF’S ACURA - SAME Darius opens her door.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I wanna see. Arnau pauses for a moment before following her outside. EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - SAME Darius and Arnau sneak around the leafless trees lining t street. Darius’ eyes fall on Kenneth walking toward Jeff, stands on the porch of the house knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FRONT PORCH
dialogues.text: Kenneth stops at the bottom of the porch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Kenneth Calloway? Kenneth sizes Jeff up.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You work out?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hello. Uh, yeah. A little.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I haven’t been able to lately. Shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, that sucks. But yeah, so I’m here cause I saw your ad in the paper, about needing a partner.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What’d you do? The credit header trick?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: The credit header?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’ve had like tons of people, four at least, show up at my door. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNETH (cont'd) Found my address connected to the PO box on credit headers.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. I didn’t know that’s what they were called.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: They were all jerks, though.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So then the position is still open?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What’s your mission?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: My mission?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Reason. For going back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Well, who wouldn’t want to? I mean, it’s an amazing opportunity. (Kenneth waits for more) You know...see dinosaurs with my own eyes? Um, watch the gladiators?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You're just tryin’ to have a laugh at me, like the rest of ‘em. Sending me joke letters, wasting my time.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No, I’m not making fun of you.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It takes guts, man. Real guts to do what I need to do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’ve got guts.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Can you look fear and danger in the eye? Have you ever?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I live inside fear and danger.  26.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Get out of here, man! Who do you work for?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: For you?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s not a trick question, jankhole! What do you know about pain and regret? Look at you! Get outta here! Kenneth brushes past Jeff and though the front door, whic SLAMS shut after him. EXT. JEFF’

dialogues.speaker: S ACURA
dialogues.text: Darius and Arnau hurry up from behind Jeff to join him as strides to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What’d he say? Was he totally Van Damme from Time Cop?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: He’s the real deal. That ad is no prank. He’s like, he’s not retarded but there’s something wrong with him. Definitely did not like me.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: So, what? That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh no, this just got good.

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: eat burgers at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What makes you think he won’t slam the door in my face, too?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You gotta be sincere and charm him. He’s used to assholes coming to make fun of him.  27.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Also probably none of the other people were beautiful girls.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Easy, Arnau.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: But use that too. There’s something off about him. You gotta go really slow, like you're trapping a skittish animal or something. Feel him out. Lure him. Girls know how to do that shit. Pretend he’s the guy all your friends want to fuck and you’re gonna be the one that gets to because you act like you don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You're dangling my vagina out there like bait? What if this guy’s a serial killer?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Then the story’s even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cold sun sets down beyond the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking through the aisles behind Kenneth again. We see Darius, casually browsing. She turns her head and makes e contact with Kenneth. Kenneth is a bit thrown off by this young woman. He re- focuses and turns left into another aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius browses in the sporting section. Kenneth tentative appears and makes himself busy rearranging a shelf. Dariu glances over discreetly. Kenneth shyly meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Do you sell guns here?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What kind of gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know, something sexy and affordable with killing power. Kenneth digests these criterium with earnestness.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hm. You probably want to go to C&R Guns in Wilkins. We only have airsoft and pellet guns.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What about one of those things with the spiky ball at the end of the chain? Does this kind of store still carry those or did Rosie O'Donnell ruin that too?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What exactly is the intended use? Like, hunting? Or pest problem?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Well if your ad had been written properly I'd have a better idea of what I need. Kenneth pauses, looks around, as if people are watching.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: My ad?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sloppy. I hope you worked harder on your calibrations.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: My calibrations are flippin’ pinpoint, okay? Darius shrugs, not convinced. Kenneth begins pacing, 28. paranoid. He nervously picks up a pink rubber coated dumb and starts distractedly doing curls with one arm.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: There’s people after me. How do I know you don’t work for them?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Cause I’ve never worked for anyone in my life. Darius’ nonsense slides so slickly out of her mouth. Kenn chews on all of it like it has meaty meaning.  29.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You ever faced certain death?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: If it was so certain I wouldn’t be here, would I? Kenneth is at a loss. She makes too much sense.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: This is a bad place to be talking. I’m off in like fifteen minutes. Let’s rendezvous. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - NIGHT Jeff sleeps, stretched out in the back seat. Arnau types laptop in the front passenger side. Darius SWINGS open the door and jumps in. Jeff springs aw

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (scared) What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Get down! Don’t let him see you. Arnau slides the seat back and ducks down, curling up in foot space. Jeff slides down onto the floor of the car.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Is he coming?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on! Darius spots the Datsun ahead of her. It flashes its brig twice before pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I got him all juicy for me but he’s all paranoid about everything. Darius starts the car and follows Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: He’s taking me to a secure location to talk more. He’s all freaked out though, he thinks people are following him.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acura follows the Datsun through the streets in the e of Wilmington past strip malls and closed water parks. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - NIGHT Jeff laughs in the back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: If this guy’s a predator taking you to a sex bunker he’s gonna freak when me and Arnau come falling out of here like some clown car. The brake lights ahead of them FLASH RED as Kenneth stops an alley behind a supermarket. He gets out of the car and walks toward the Acura, now also stopped. Darius tenses.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What’s going on out there?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: He’s coming!

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Oh man. Arnau curls into a smaller, frightened ball on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don’t let him see us. We'll blow it all!

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What do I do? Kenneth is almost to the Acura. Then HEADLIGHTS light him up as a car pulls into the alle behind them. Darius thinks fast and seizes the opportunit putting the car in drive. Kenneth steps back she Darius accelerates. She shouts out window as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: We're being followed! Go!  31. Darius’ Acura speeds around the Datsun and turns a corner Kenneth’s eyes go wide at the innocently approaching car. turns and sprints for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OVERWEIGHT BOYFRIEND AND GIRLFRIEND watch Kenneth’s panicked run to his car.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? They slow as they approach. Kenneth opens his trunk and p out a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND
dialogues.text: Git! Git! Go! Git out! The Boyfriend wildly swerves his car and speeds away. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - NIGHT Darius pulls over on the side of the road around the corn

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are we?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Just get out and I’1l come pick you up after I’m done. Jeff looks out the window and sees a row of run-down hous On one porch several BLACK MEN in wife beaters drink from brown bagged bottles.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: (wary) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What are you guys, racist? Her cell phone RINGS, lighting up the car interior.  32.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Hello? INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - NIGHT A shaking, spooked Kenneth drives with his cell to his ea

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s too hot here right now. I have a gut feeling you’re not with them but, but I just don’t know. I’m gonna do a background check on you and I‘1l be in touch if everything's good, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS, (VO)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Okay. Good-bye, uh, good night. Kenneth hangs up. He leans over and looks at his face in rear view mirror. He pushes his ear back closer to his he and studies himself, positioned so that only that half of head is visible in the mirror. He keeps driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius wakes up to bright daylight filling the room. She out of her bed. Arnau sleeps on the other bed. Jeff is go She rubs her eyes and checks her cell phone. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff enters a salon where a half dozen STYLISTS do their thing. A MAN and WOMAN occupy the RECEPTIONIST so Jeff dr back against the far wall and surveys the interior. His hopeful eyes settle on a thin BLOND, who turns around reveals her face. Not her. Jeff scans the other stylists. finally focuses on a wood cutting of the name LIZ in one stylists’ area. He studies the woman cutting hair there. LIZ CLEARY, 30, is more than a little on the heavy side, brown hair, pale skin and generally does not match Jeff's description of a sun-kissed beach blond hottie. Jeff stares at her, the brightness fading from his eyes. He turns and exits the salon.  33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sits at the bar with Darius and Arnau and wiggles hi fingers in front of his face while grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: She was, she was big, and like...

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Your age? I know, gross.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Let’s just say the years have not been kind. They pretty much took a shit all over her.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: When I go back in time with him I’m finding you as a child and turning you gay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Did dude call yet?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don’t sweat it. He’ll call. Your weird mojo clicked with his weird mojo and you got him in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Should we like do a background check on him, or something? Make sure he’s not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: He seems pretty harmless. Jeff's eyes follow a young HOSTESS who walks toward them before meeting up with her baby-faced BOYFRIEND, 17. A br reality check registers on Jeff's face. Darius sees.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Unlike perv-ison here. That girl’s like twelve.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What girl? INT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - DAY Over Kenneth’s shoulder we see his computer screen.  34. ON SCREEN: Darius’ MySpace profile. We see as he scrolls: --Darius has 0 friends. --Under “Here For”: Quantifying my self worth by the qual of total strangers who hit on me here. --CLICKS on “Photos”: Various photos of Darius doing pris poses, flashing fake gold teeth, and throwing up gang sig on a bed covered with one dollar bills. Kenneth leans more into frame and we hear TYPING. ON SCREEN: A Google search. Darius Britt. Various version the same article appear. The gist of all of them: Ridgewo Woman Murdered...survived by husband Phillip Britt and daughter Darius Britt. Kenneth’s arm comes into frame, holding a cell to his ear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Friday night lights glisten off the wet grass in a me sized stadium. Two high school teams take the field. We follow Darius through a crowd and up the bleacher stai past the seated band, pounding their drums, to the top ro

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hi. Kenneth puts down a seat pad next to him. Darius sits on

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (almost yelling) I hope you don’t mind the noise. It’s a good public place to meet. They won’t be able to hear our conversation.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I would have done the same. Who are we dealing with here?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Can’t say for sure. They’ve been following me, monitoring me since I started this mission. Government agents maybe. Probably.  35.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Look. I just need to know if you’re some kind of nutjob and this is all bullshit or if you’re legit.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Oh I’m legit. Darius gives him a dead stare.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Trust me. I didn’t put up that ad just so people would make fun of me. They wouldn’t do that to my face! Darius isn’t threatened by his awkward attempt at rage.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I don’t want to get jerked around.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Jerking around is for jerks.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: Jeff and Arnau sit a good distance away, watching Darius afar. Jeff opens a small cooler and forces a beer on Arna before taking one for himself. Jeff breathes in.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: God, I remember that smell. The smell of grass, you know? And the sound of the drums.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: You should give Liz a chance. That sucks to spend all those years wondering about her and you’re finally here and you don’t go through with it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: All that time I was wondering About her she didn’t look like a female butcher.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: That's sad if the love of your youth was just based on what a girl looked like in her bikini.  36.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Naw, it’s not like that. It wasn’t her looks. She had the hottest southern accent. And she was so, I don’t know, warm. I don’t know how to describe it.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: How do you know she’s still not? Jeff thinks about it. Then looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Dude, there’s a ton of hot chicks. Arnau looks. There are.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: They're like all sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You should fucking put the moves on these chicks. An uptight MOM in the row in front of Jeff frowns.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Well what?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I'll go see Liz again if you start talking to that chick right there.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: They're high school girls.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, and you're a college guy. Who do you think high school girls fuck? They get an angry head turn from Mom.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: Darius plays it cool and straight.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: So what’s the year? Where are we going?  37.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: 2003. Does that work for you?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Perfect. That gives me time to do what I need to do. What are the...means of transportation?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hold it in your holster for a sec. I’m still making up my mind about you as a potential partner. I have to be completely certain I can trust you before I include you in certain information.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: That’s fair. What’s the time table?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: There’s a critical step soon. I need to obtain certain materials to facilitate the travel. I’m planning to execute this within the next week. As far as you’re concerned, this is an evaluation period. I’m not making any promises.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Why 2003? What are you going back for?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Like I said, certain details will have to wait. Kenneth goes silent, suspiciously eyeing the GUY sitting nearest to them, then gives Darius a poignant look. She n

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: A DEPUTY SHERIFF walks up the bleacher steps. The Mom sta and points out Jeff and Arnau.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Right there, officer. Jeff downs a gulp of his beer and looks around, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: These two. The Deputy beckons to Jeff with his finger.  38.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: You two! Up! Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: You're drinking alcohol at a high school football game. Come on. Arnau takes a deep breath, his world ending around him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It’s a football game.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Smartass if I have to ask you one more time!

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: Heads are turning to see what the ruckus is about. Kennet and Darius look over and spot the Deputy shouting at Jeff Darius’ eyes go wide for a moment as Kenneth looks.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: These drums are giving me a headache. Is there somewhere else we can go? Kenneth takes his eyes away from the scene.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: Who are now up, being escorted away by the Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: That's right. Get them out of here!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, he’s still gonna fuck your daughter. The Deputy WHIPS his red face around. Arnau shakes his he apologetically to the Mom and Deputy.  39.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: No, that’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: EXT HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL STADIUM
dialogues.text: Darius and Kenneth weave through the crowd. They pass a g of ROWDY TEENS, where a big BEEFHEAD KID, 18, roughhouses with a JOCK. Kenneth is BOWLED OVER by this big mutant, knocked to the ground. The Jock then slaps Beefhead’s hand holding his fountain soda, causing it to spill all over Kenneth. The teens LAUGH. The Beefhead pretends to have remorse. Darius helps Kenneth to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: BEEFHEAD
dialogues.text: (through a big grin) I’m sorry man. It was his fault.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: W-w-w-watch it, man.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: (mock stuttering) I-I-I can’t believe you just assaulted a retard. Kenneth is suddenly tight and uncomfortable, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You guys are total assholes. Beefhead and Jock turn to face Darius.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I mean, how useless are you? At least all the other fatasses are out there playing football right now. And this one? Darius looks at the Jock, as if to speak, but SLAPS his elbow, knocking his fountain soda into his own face.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: You fucking bitch. The other teens pull him back as Kenneth leads Darius awa

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I'd have really messed them up if I wasn’t trying to keep a low profile. But I’m glad I got to see your qualities. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNETH (cont'd) I think you’re ready for the next phase, some basic training. Kenneth spots the Jock approaching with another DEPUTY SH

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: The heat’s moving in. That’s all for tonight. The Jock points her out to the Deputy Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: That’s her! She assaulted me with my drink. Darius turns back to Kenneth but he’s gone. One with the night. She sighs and turns to face the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Arnau are escorted out through a gated door in t fence just as Darius is led through at the same time by h own Deputy Sheriff. They all eye each other curiously.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Seriously, how'd you guys get kicked out of a high school football game? INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - NIGHT Kenneth climbs into his seat. He looks at the Coke stain his shirt. He SLAPS the steering wheel over and over. Thi isn’t the first time he’s been humiliated. He performs a few karate moves with his arms, complete wi self-generated sound effects, re-playing in his mind what wished he could’ve done to those guys. The driver's side window FALLS in its slot, disappearing the door. Kenneth stops and looks at his broken window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Darius fires a .22 handgun in a remote woodland. A bottle on a fallen tree shatters. Kenneth nods.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Nice. You smoked it.  41. Kenneth pushes PLAY on a cassette deck boom box he’s hung from a branch by its strap. Cheap Trick’s cheesy 80’s anthem “MIGHTY WINGS” plays, as recorded off of the radio two decades ago. Kenneth nods to the music, really finding the elusive zon through its lyrics, then fires his gun at a bottle. The t chips off and he finishes it off with two more shots.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I’m getting better than you. All I need is one shot. Kenneth, insulted, takes her joke personally.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s easy to shoot standing still with no pressure. Kenneth runs a few steps, then takes a dramatic stance wi both knees bent, both arms extending his gun out, and FIR

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: But you have to be able to shoot on the move... Kenneth spins and fires off two more shots.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: ..-with the heat flying by... He drops to a knee and FIRES, then pulls out a backup gun

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: .-.-do what I’m doing. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Really? Kenneth ducks behind a tree, faking like he’s under fire, then spins out from the cover and shoots a bottle. It all looks very awkward and slowly paced.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come on! Darius imitates him, but with only a fraction of his effo and intensity.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Smoke it! Come on, smoke it! Darius fires some shots.  42.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: They’re closing in. Smoke ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Okay, just shut up. Darius finally hits a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah! You smoked him.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yes, I smoked him. He’s smoked. An enraged MAN IN A FLANNEL storms through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN FLANNEL
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop your shooting! They freeze as the man screams toward them.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN FLANNEL
dialogues.text: My house is back there! You put a hole in my swimming pool you jackasses!

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Should I smoke him?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Run, go! Darius and Kenneth take off into the woods. The Man in Flannel huffs and puffs but just stops, hands on hips. Running side by side, Darius sneaks a sideways peek at Kenneth’s face as he runs. She can’t help but burst out i laughter at the comical severity of his expression as he breathes rapidly in and out through his O-lips. Kenneth tones it down as they slow their clip.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What? She just keeps laughing good-naturedly. Kenneth cracks a smile, too. Soon they’re both laughing hard. EXT. LIZ’S HOUSE - DAY Jeff waits on the porch of a cute little cottage style ho Liz opens the door.  43.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hello, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Jeff! Oh my goodness! Look at you. Come here! She's all sweet southern goodness, like a hot cotton T-sh right out of the dryer. She hugs him fondly, looks him ov

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about yesterday. I’m here on work and something came up, I just couldn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I was so sad when you didn’t come after you got me thinking about you on that Facebook. Isn’t Facebook just the craziest thing? Come in, get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz draws him into the house.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This is the best smelling house I've ever been inside.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Well what do the houses in New York smell like?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Like Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I just have to get on the computer and read this magazine of yours. That’s so exciting, I always knew you were going to do something special with your life.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Special? Easy now. Jeff winces and rubs his neck.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with your neck, honey?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m sharing a bed with my intern. I sleep like a stiff corpse, trying not to rub ass with the guy.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You need heat on that...Oh! I have pies in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Wow, you made them? Like with flour and that roller thing?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I made a peach, apple and strawberry rhubarb. Which kind do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius and Kenneth sip Gatorade while sitting in the shad a wooded hilltop overlooking the parked Datsun.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: That was some good training we got in. I got to see you under pressure. I think you're ready for initiation.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I was born ready.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I like your intensity. You’re like, no-nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: There’s no sense in nonsense. Especially when the heat’s hot.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Exactly. Kenneth nods. She’s speaking his language.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: They wouldn’t be making fun of me if they saw us just now. Sometimes I wish I was like a superhero that doesn’t stop crime, but like steps in when someone’s getting made fun of and stops that, you know? Not me, but other people that get made fun of, that aren’t tough like me.  45. Darius looks at Kenneth in a way we don’t recognize from Something changes here. She’s no longer making fun of him

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: But you’re pretty good with the gun. No, you’re damn good.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I like your intensity, too. You've got good moves.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I do have to know what you’re going back for, though. Darius looks at him questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I have a certain responsibility to keep.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Right. That’s fair. Okay. (beat) I’m going back to stop my mother from dying when I was fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: How'd she die?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: She was killed by some guy. Just some guy at a gas station took her and killed her.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Oh man. Like a random thing?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, no. She was driving home. It was late, like after midnight. And she called me to tell me she was on her way home. And I - (beat) I asked her to stop and get me some chocolate milk. Because I had to have chocolate milk. So like five minutes later she calls me from the gas station and says they had it and she was coming home. Her voice was so excited. Like she was so happy to get this chocolate milk for me. And I was just like whatever. I wasn’t even nice. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARIUS (cont'd) And that was it. Last time I talked to her. So, no. It wasn’t quite random that she was there.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: But it wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: That’s what they tell me. Silent beat. Kenneth nods affirmatively to himself.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You're ready. I trust you, Darius. A speck of guilt in Darius’ eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Good. You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz has a heating pad wrapped around Jeff's neck as she r the trouble spot. A half eaten pie rests on the table.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You bake pies like this and you’re not married? What’s going on there?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I was married. Married this boy when I was twenty and that didn’t work out.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He was a ball player, so I followed him around everywhere his team went, he was in the minor leagues for four years. I was the good little wife, working to support the both of us, baking cookies for the team. Jeff takes a bite of pie, neck wrapped in heating pad, Li massaging his shoulder. He’s on a cloud.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Ohh, cookies, too?  47.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: But as soon as Cameron got called up to the Marlins and started making money he started running around with those Miami girls and that was that. I came back here.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What a dick.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Well, we were both young. It happens. Hey, do you have a free night while you're here? I want to make you a homemade dinner.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (nearly cooing) I want to eat that homemade dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius and Kenneth at a booth in the country kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s important that we don’t abuse the power that will come with our knowledge of the future. No matter how tempting it might be to be the first poster on a message board to “find” all the secrets of the newest video games. Or to say, you know, hey I think that Battlestar Galactica show might really be awesome before anyone else is talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What about, for the betterment of future society, assassinating certain celebrities when they were vulnerable before they got famous and got entourages?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. We must stick to the plan.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: So when do you fill me in on it?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Soon. The action’s getting hungry. Real hungry.  48. Darius spots a KID, 5, at a table licking the sugar bottl

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Oh my god. The Kid proceeds to place the whole rim of the salt shake his sloppy mouth while his MOM ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I can’t eat here.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Do you see this mutant kid? I’m getting nauseous. I can’t look. Kenneth turns to look and Darius notices his left ear off kilter. It sticks out in an odd angle.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Oh. Something... your ear - Kenneth’s eyes go rigid with fear. He feels at his ears, SNAPS the ear back into place.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. It, uh. Kenneth is running out of breath, near panic attack.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s cool. We can eat here. Kenneth’s panic mixes with anger and he curses at himself

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Stupid! Forget it, it’s off. Kenneth gets up and storms out of the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius follows him out as he rushes to his car.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Dude, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I changed my mind. You're not the right one.  49. Kenneth gets into his car. Darius runs to the window but pulls away. She stops, confused. The car pulls onto the road, begins to speed away, then brakes. It finally stops on the side of the road. Darius watches for a moment, then walks over to the car. Kenneth has his head on the wheel. Darius leans down.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenny, what’s the deal? He sits back, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s fake.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: My ear.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s fake?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I was born with only one.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Is that what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: They used to make fun of me. All the other kids. My parents could only afford one prosthetic so they waited until I stopped growing.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, I don’t care. It’s nothing to be embarrassed about. Shit, people made fun of me, too. I wax my lip and shave my arms. I know it’s not the same, but I get it, you know? I had a freaking mustache until I was fifteen. Darius places a gentle hand on Kenneth’s tense shoulder. reacts like it’s electricity, like human contact is somet he’s starved of, and he just tasted the best kind there i  50.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: We can still do this if we just never talk about it again. Please.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Okay. Kenneth silently unlocks the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius types on the laptop while Arnau jots down notes.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: (to Darius) So then what’d you tell him your reason for going to 2003 is?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I just made up some story.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Yeah, what’s the story?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I told him I wanted to go back and stop my parents from getting divorced. Jeff enters the room, a bounce in his step.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: There he is. Jeff slaps Arnau’s back.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Arnau, the man.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Whatever I’m doing, I’m feeling fucking fantastic doing it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Did you just have sex with that fat girl you came here to stalk?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No we didn’t. We shared nice conversation. And she’s not that fat. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF (cont'd) A girl's beauty is, it’s in the eyes, you know? And that never goes away. Darius does the jack-off motion.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No wonder you didn’t nail her, with lines like that.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: So anyways, for the article we should know what’s wrong with this guy. Like low I.Q., or emotional disorder, or whatever it is.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What makes you think he’s ‘got’ something?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: He thinks he’s going back in time.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: So? Did Einstein have something wrong with him? Or David Bowie?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s just a guy trying to do something new. What makes that such a freak show? Jeff watches Darius with curiosity as he cracks a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So you think it’s normal?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Is it normal that your interns do all the work on your story? Is that how all your articles get written?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m better at running things. Leading. I’m not good with like words and shit and making sentences sound good.  52.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: That's probably kind of important, being that your job is writing.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I never thought of myself as a writer. I got the job off of something I wrote in college, but it took me all fucking year to write that thing. And it only turned out so good because it was about the one thing I could get into and really write well about. It’s funny how you can do one thing and you just become that guy. Your whole life gets defined by it. And it was just like an accident in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What was it about? Darius’ cell RINGS. She looks at the name.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s him. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old van rushes by Darius, bundled in a hoodie on the sidewalk. The van slows and pulls to the curb down the ro bit. Darius chases after and the door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van comes to a stop in the field behind the medical research facility we saw Kenneth casing earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth and Darius.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: There’s technology inside this building that I need to complete the machine that will take us on our journey. Kenneth hands her a clipboard of notes.  53.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I'll breach the outer perimeter, disable their security measures, penetrate the target, locate and secure the package, then rendezvous with you at the getaway point. The details are all in these notes. Darius flips through the notes. Page after page of diagra maps, lists, and action drawings of Kenneth fighting guar Kenneth pulls a black mask over his face. He gets out of van. Darius follows him with her eyes as he runs to the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth performs an unnecessary somersault roll to come t stop against the eight foot wall. He rises, jumps up and catches the ledge of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard sits in a parked car on the inside of walled compound, studying materials for some class that w no doubt lead to a meteoric rise up the socioeconomic lad His study is interrupted by a handgun pointed through the window by Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard unlocks the double-wide back doors on the raise loading dock in the back of the facility while Kenneth kn in a dramatic pose in the shadows, gun on the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth rolls a wheeled cart out of a storage closet, the locks the Guard inside the closet with his own keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth flies down a long hallway in a panic, looking a b lost as he pushes the cart as fast as he can. He turns a corner wildly and rolls into a large lounge ar where over a dozen EMPLOYEES celebrate a CO-WORKER’S birt with cake and food. Kenneth pulls his cart to a stop. No one notices him. He backs the cart out the way he came, completely unseen.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard lays down on a mattress made from boxes and foa pads and gets comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth wheels the cart into a store room and begins load it up with medical devices about the size and shape of ol answering machine phones. They have bases and handpieces connected by a wire. We glimpse wording on the side of one unit: DIODE LASER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employees from the party chat in the hallway as Kenneth wheels his cart around a corner. He stops and the laser devices spill onto the floor. The employees watch him, unsure what to do, as he pulls his m back over his face and scrambles to retrieve the lasers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius’ cell phone lights up. She sits up straight, gathe herself and turns the key in the ignition. The van doesn’ start. She looks around, confused, then spots the manual stick shift. Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Crap, stick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth wheels the cart out through the back doors onto t loading dock. The curious employees follow him out, still quite sure how to react to this situation. Some try to ta to Kenneth, while ONE GUY is on his cell phone, gesturing if giving play-by-play of what’s going on. Kenneth’s head whips around searching for the getaway. We see a festive sign posted on the door behind him announcing a birthday party for ELLA PARKS tonight. The van jumps and jerks its way close to the loading dock Kenneth wheels the cart to the back, opens the rear doors spills the contents of the cart into the back. He jumps inside the van and shuts the doors.  55. The employees at the back door watch the van pull away, t stall. It starts up, moves another ten yards and stalls again. It starts, JUMPS forward and SPEEDS out of the lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is parked next to Kenneth’s Datsun in a dry river under a rural highway overpass. Darius watches Kenneth hurriedly transfer the lasers from the van to the Datsun.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What do we do with the van?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Leave it. I stole it from a lot.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, you didn’t hurt anyone in there, did you? Kenneth shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: No casualties. Darius grips Kenneth’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You're shaking. Kenneth looks down sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Adrenaline from the infiltration. INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - MOMENTS LATER Kenneth steers around a bend to a dirt path leading up to highway with the headlights off.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: No! There’s a night road work crew ahead of them. Bright stan lights illuminate a traffic light in need of repair as a WORKER is raised up in a crane to reach it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s fine. They won't know.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: We can’t have any witnesses to connect my car to the van. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNETH (cont'd) The people that are after me will be on full alert after tonight. They’1l put the pieces together. Kenneth reaches the verge of another panic attack.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Dangit! Why didn’t I plan for this? This is not good. Not good! Darius puts her hand on his back.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: We'll just wait here until they’re done. It’1ll be okay. Kenneth nods, breathes deeply, then steers the car behind some brush and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m just so close now.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s cool. I know.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s a girl. Darius looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’m going back for a girl. Belinda St. Sing.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Who was she?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: My first girlfriend. Only one I ever wanted to have. We were both twenty-one. Her birthday was the same day in April as mine is in October. She was really, really pretty. When she first started working at the restaurant I didn’t really think about her. But then she was so nice to me. She’d get me food. She’d talk to me while I cleaned up. Everyone else was off getting ready to go out, all her friends. But she’d sit there on the stool and talk to me.  57.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: She died. Some jerk, some a-hole jerk in a band who got drunk after his show, crashed his car into her house one night. A night I was supposed to be there but wasn’t. I should’ve been there.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You would've just gotten hurt, too. It’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Everyone always says there’s plenty of other girls out there. But it doesn’t work like that. It’s not just about the girl, it’s about a time and a place. You just can’t go find that again. Darius leans back in her seat, sleepy, and somehow so comfortable in this odd place and company.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I like your reason for going back, Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun creeps up, cold in the misty air. Long shot of th Datsun dropping Darius off at the park before driving awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff scarfs down a mini-box of Raisin Bran across the tab from Darius and Arnau.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Fucking lasers?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What kind of lasers?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I don’t know I’m not a freaking Storm Trooper.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This guy’s awesome. He’s over there right now really thinking he’s building a damn time machine. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF (cont'd) Arnau, what are the chances he can really do it with these lasers?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: How would I know, I’m not a -

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: He’s not a freaking Storm Trooper.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Storm Troopers don’t know shit about lasers or time travel, they're fucking blue collar workers. (mouth full) I gotta go see this shit. EXT. KENNETH’S SHED - DAY Darius, Jeff and Arnau sneak to the locked shed next to t house. Jeff tries to climb up the shed wall to peer in through the crack between the roof and wall.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Isn't this like violating his privacy?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I can’t see down far enough. Jeff drops back down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What are you building in there, Kenny? Arnau, on look-out, frantically combines as many warning gestures as his mind holds: throat slash, incomplete pass thumbs down, etc. Jeff and Darius crouch and hold their breath as KENNETH emerges from the shed and locks the many locks behind him He carries a large box to his car and loads it into the t

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Shit. Get the fuck outta here. A SUNGLASSED MAN in dark slacks and jacket appears from t trees beyond Kenneth’s house and runs across the street. gets into a black sedan parked around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Who's this asshole?  59. Kenneth’s Datsun drives away. The black sedan slowly pull out onto the main street and follows his car.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: They're following him. Oh my God. There really are people following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth’s Datsun turns right onto a residential street. Moments later the Sedan does the same. Next comes the Acura, Jeff behind the wheel. INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - DAY Kenneth checks his rear-view mirror and sees the Sedan a distance behind him. He makes another turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in sunglasses nods to his nearly identical partne We'll call them JONES and SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Stay back. Don’t spook him. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - DAY Jeff trails the black sedan.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Stay back. Don’t scare them.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This is fucking intense.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: We're going fifteen miles an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones watches Kenneth’s Datsun abruptly turn onto a side

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Shit, he saw us. Go! Smith looks in his rear-view and raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I think we’re being trailed. Jones spins around.  60.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Huh? INT. JEFF’S ACURA - DAY The Sedan in front of them quickly speeds up and turns ar a corner out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Shit, they’re on to us.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: On to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOCAL WOMAN pulls her car to the end of her driveway, braking for the Datsun to drive by. Kenneth reaches the dead end and does a tight U-Turn, kic up dirt and tearing up the corner of someone’s lawn. The local woman slams on her brakes before pulling out, surprised by Kenneth’s quick turnabout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith guns the sedan around the corner onto the dead end street and swerves to avoid swiping the nose of the local woman’s car. He hits the brakes hard as Kenneth drives pa

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Shiiiit. Kenneth glares at them as he passes and continues in the opposite direction. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - DAY Jeff takes the corner tight and fast. The Datsun appears both cars brake to avoid a collision. Jeff and Darius duck their heads down.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Don’t let him see you! INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - DAY Kenneth looks into the Acura as he steers around it and o the main street. All he sees is Arnau, frozen like a deer the backseat, staring back. The front looks completely em Kenneth, confused, speeds away.  61. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - DAY Arnau exchanges the same confused looks with Smith and Jo who slowly drive past before speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What the hell, did you see those guys?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: They look like government agents or something.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: (amazed) He’s really being followed.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (laughing) Holy shit is this guy for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sips on a milk shake as Arnau types on the laptop on picnic table. Darius’ cell RINGS. She answers. Jeff hovers. She eyes hi and turns away for privacy.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth? Are you okay? Jeff shoots an arched eyebrow at Darius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth paces, cell to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hey. The heat got too hot today. They’re all over me. Way too hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius covers her open ear.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Who is?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (VO)
dialogues.text: (on phone) I can’t talk. Just watch your back. Stay low and lay low. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNETH (VO) (cont'd) Go to the park, I’1l come get you. It’s almost time. Click. Darius lowers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Look at you.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Are you in love with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You're getting all worked up about this whole thing. What’s been going on with you two when you’re off alone?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I’m doing what you made me do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Maybe that was his plan the whole time. Whoever answered that ad would have to be his soulmate.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: It was like a personal ad.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: E-harmony for lunatics.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You guys are assholes. Take me to the park. I’m meeting him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oooh, for a picnic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius and Kenneth on the outer edge of the vast U-Save l

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s obvious they see a threat in me possessing this kind of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s not clear what entity they represent. Their presence here accelerates the plan, though. 63. Kenneth hands Darius a wide shoebox wrapped in a string.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: They’1l have one of their guys at every door, but you should be fine. I don’t think they’ve ID’d you yet.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius carries the box inside. She can’t help but eye the unconcerned OLD LADY waiting by the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STOCKBOY leads Darius into a back storeroom and points the weary old black man, Shannon, who we saw Kenneth talk to at work earlier. Darius approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Shannon? Shannon leans a dolly against a wall and turns.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes ma’am. Darius holds out the box.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: This is from Kenneth. He wanted me to give it to you. Shannon, surprised, slowly takes the box from her. watches him slide the string off and open the lid. She Inside are thousands of dollars. Looks like every last do Kenneth could possibly have.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Kenneth said to give this to me? Darius, shocked as much as Shannon is, nods.  64. Shannon tries to speak, but is overcome by emotion. He sh his head, his tired eyes fighting off tears.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I don’t even know how to thank the man.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You tell him... Shannon chokes up.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I know. I’11 tell him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And tell him I hope he gets wherever he’s goin’ an’ it all works out how he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius walks through the lot. Her face is a bit blank, a overwhelmed. She looks so much softer than when we met he INT. KENNETH’S DATSUN - SAME Darius gets in and just stares at Kenneth, a smile in her eyes, trouble in the rest of her face. Kenneth looks back her, then the road, then her.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Nothing. EXT. LIZ’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - DAY Jeff sits at a picnic table while a wholesome feast is la out before him by Liz.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It sounds dangerous. Her running around with this guy and these other men following him around.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Ah, she'll be fine. There’s still leftover pie, right?  65. Liz brings him an icy bottle of beer.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Do you remember when you talked me into going on that boat with that strange man?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, see. Nothing bad happened to us. We got to go wake boarding, had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He spent all day taking photographs of me in my bathing suit!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, he never did mail those to us like he said he would, did he?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No! He was probably a sexual predator and you threw me right to him so you could waterski.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It worked out, right? Fair trade. I’m sure he got some pleasure out of those photos.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He took hundreds!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: How did I not even think that was weird at the time? Liz falls down into his lap playfully.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: He took a lot of you so he might’ve been getting pleasure out of those ones, too.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Well of course he did. I was ripped back then.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh you were not. You were scrawny. Jeff forces her hand onto his chest.  66.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, well feel me now. Liz rolls her eyes. Jeff kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun parks in a remote wooded area where a small ca area consisting of open, wood framed shelters blends into fall foliage. Darius and Kenneth get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: The place we’re going is a short walk, maybe five minutes from here. You have to make sure you remember how to get here. Darius strolls along the camp shelters.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Here. Kenneth leads her to one of the shelters where a sleeping lies next to a duffle. Some books are scattered on the wo floor next to a cooler. Kenneth opens the cooler and take local trail map out of it.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: This is your stuff? Kenneth draws on the map with a pen.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Boy Scouts don’t use this place after September so I just kind of set up here, like having a second home to come spend some nights, you know. Clear the head. Darius digs into one of the boxes and pulls out a an old zither, a kind of flat, square guitar that’s laid on your knees when you play it.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: There, I drew the location on here so you'll always be able to get there.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You play this?  67.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I’ve been trying. Belinda really loved music. Back when we were together I always wished I could play her something. My dad had one of these so I’ve been learning some songs for when I see her again. I want to be a better man for her this time.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Play something.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Oh, nah.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Come on. You need to practice on somebody. I’1l tell you if it’s good.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. Kenneth takes the zither and sits down, laying it across knees. He begins to play. It’s Van Halen’s When It’s Love but it’s hard to recogniz slowed down. He plays like a savant, technically perfect, even adding notes to fill spaces. Darius watches with wonder. The sound is amazing. Then he begins to SING.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (singing) Everybody's lookin’ for somethin’, somethin’ to fill the holes... His voice isn’t great, but not bad either. He sings softl sincerely. It’s at once ridiculous and beautiful. He wrap

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, oh, oh, when it’s love. His shy eyes can’t even look up at Darius.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: So anyway, that’s one of them. I’ve learned like thirty of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth it’s so good.  68.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: So good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff collapses onto Liz’s full cleavage in the aftermath heated, partially clothed spontaneous sex on her couch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That’s the best I’ve ever had. I’m not lying. Liz giggles.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: That’s what you said about the fried chicken.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I’m so serious. Jeff props himself up and gazes at her, his brain loaded food and sex pleasure chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You don’t now how long I’ve been thinking about this right here. Ever since I used to come down here in the summers I never met a girl like you. You’ve been this character in my head like from an old fairy tale. Like you were the last of a kind that doesn’t exist anymore.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (laughing) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No, I’m so serious, I wrote a story about you. Like how love never feels as good as the first one, and you can’t ever get that high again.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You’re so cute.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I want you to come to New York.  69.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I want to figure this out, make it happen.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Jeff, Jeff, Jeff. You’re not in your right mind right now.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I'm completely sincere about this, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Jeff. As soon as you drive out of this place you’re not going to want me there anymore.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Come on, don’t you feel this?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It’s a fantasy. This is fantasy time. I’m dating a real solid man right now. He works at the post office, he grew up here. This isn’t a fantasy world for him. He can take care of me.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So can I.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Jeff, I’ve been through that before. I’m too old to take those chances again. Jeff stands up, now becoming angry.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So no? You’re saying no?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This is un-fucking-believable. I stretched my ass out on the line here and look what I get. Fucking punched in the face. Hey asshole, follow your heart. Listen to your heart. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF (cont'd) Oh, ok, what’s that you say, heart? You just got punked and now you look like a giant dildo.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Jeff, I think you’re acting a little crazy about this.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Jeff punches the air, but tweaks his back muscle, and dou over holding his neck. EXT. LIZ’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Jeff marches away from Liz, fuming. She watches him go wi sympathy from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth leads Darius down a hill to an old, large tree on edge of a wide lake. A rope swing with a wood disk at the hangs from a branch that stretches over the water.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Here it is. Kenneth finds a large knot in the tree, reaches his arm u into it, pulling away a small wood covering. He strains u he pulls an old army ammunition tin out of the tree hollo

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: When we go back in time, if anything bad happens, if anyone gets hurt, you mess up, the people after me catch us, anything bad - come here and put a note inside. I’'1l do the same, then we know what went wrong and we can fix it. Got it? This is very important. Darius nods. Kenneth looks inside the box. It’s empty.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: So far so good.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: This was here in 2003?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: It’s been here since I was a kid. I used to camp back there when I was in the Boy Scouts. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNETH (cont'd) Some of the other kids used to make fun of me for bringing my Star Wars figures with me, cause I didn’t want them to be alone back at my house, so they’d take them and throw them into the fire and laugh at me for sleeping with them. This was before my martial arts training, of course. I carved out this hiding spot for them so I could still take them with me and no one would hurt them. I’d just sneak down here at night and take them out, then put them back in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I wish I could see you when you were a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: (snort laughs) I was not as impressive as I am now. Kenneth replaces the box back into the tree. Darius runs finger along the wooden disk at the end of the rope, teth to the trunk by a nail.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Me and my dad made that, too.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What do you do? Swing?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yeah, get on.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No, I’m not much of a swinger.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come on, get on. Kenneth unhooks the swing from the nail and holds the dis flat for her.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come on. I played that song. Darius reluctantly swings her leg around the rope and straddles it, seated on the disk, feet dangling a few fee off the ground while Kenneth holds it in place.  72.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hold on! Kenneth SPRINTS forward toward the pond, running down the hill, pushing Darius on the swing. Their faces are a few apart, her eyes wide with surprise, his wide with the gle you normally only see in a child’s. Kenneth pushes her to the lake’s edge and lets go. Darius, hands tight on the rope, swings free and far out the water. She swings back over land. Kenneth laughs as he chases he He grabs onto the disk and tucks up his legs as she begin swing back to the lake, now with Kenneth hanging on. The two of them soar over the lake. At the highest point Kenneth lets go and splashes into the water. Darius swings back over the land, half screaming, half laughing. Kenneth motions her into the water with his han

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come on! Jump! Darius makes another pass over him, shaking her head ‘no.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: How else are you going to get off? Darius swings over the land, then clenches her eyes shut she flies back over the water. She pushes off. The swing back alone. She plunges into the cold water. She splashes to the surface and swats water at Kenneth, w laughs. To the music, a series of shots: -- Kenneth holding Darius’ hand, helping her out of the water. -- Kenneth giving a soaked Darius the only towel out of t back of the Datsun and helping wrap her up in it. -- Kenneth, shivering cold, gets a fire started in the ca fire pit as night falls. Darius, snug in her towel, laugh he squats down right in the fire, desperate for the warmt  73. -- They sit by the fire. Kenneth lights the wing of a pap airplane and sends it on a fiery flight. Darius takes his head in her hands so softly. He’s paraly Her hands run over his ears. Kenneth’s hand defensively g her wrist to pull it away from his prosthetic, but then h relaxes and lets her arm go. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnau plays his online game on the laptop. Jeff enters wi the most deadly serious look on his face. Arnau meets his gaze, apprehension gripping his soul. Cheap Trick’s “Mighty Wings” ramps up, full force... INT. JEFF’S ACURA - NIGHT The Acura cruises down the road, windows down. Jeff looks over at Arnau, gives him a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Arnau have a drink at the bar. Jeff scans the jo Nothing but sad bar regulars and a 50 year-old COCKTAIL WAITRESS. Jeff downs his drink and gets up, on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff exits the Acura. A group of three GIRLS and one SOUT GOTH GUY wave him over from the corner of the storefront. Arnau watches from the car. The most audacious of this group, LINSEY, holds out a twe dollar bill to Jeff and motions toward the liquor store a she politely pleads with him. This group is obviously und 21, how far under we’ll never know. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - NIGHT Arnau is squeezed in the back seat next to a DECENT GIRL, FRIEND, and the Goth Guy. In the front seat, Linsey chugs Hard Lemonade. Jeff looks over at her, widens his eyes an lowers her bottle down out of view from the outside. Linsey laughs and playfully swats his hand away.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, Arnau and their new friends on the beach with burnt fireworks and empty bottles. Linsey chases Jeff with a sparkler while the Goth Guy shoots bottle rockets at Arna and the other two chicks, who run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: GOTH GUY
dialogues.text: Oh shit the cops! Jeff looks up to see a police cruiser on the far side of dune above them. Everyone runs, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a quiet, remote street, the Acura does donuts. INT. JEFF’S ACURA - CONTINUOUS Arnau braces in the backseat, girls falling all over him. Jeff looks back from the front and screams euphorically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff emerges from the bathroom, passes the two queen beds one with Linsey and another girl passed out on it, the ne with the Goth guy and the Decent Girl on it watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnau gets a Nestea from a soda machine. Jeff approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: They still in there?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, where’ve you been? That girl’s in there waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Nah. You go.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Dude, this isn’t about me. This is all for you. You better get back in there and handle business.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Are you gay, Arnau? Cause that I can handle. That I’11 understand.  Jeff EXT. Jeff INT. Jeff with 75.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: No, I’m not gay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Come on, just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No. It’s all set up perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Whatever, you act like it’s so easy.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Yeah. It is for you. And people that look like you.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You don’t even know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: No, you don’t! You wouldn’t do anything either if you were me and you know it. Do you want to see me get embarrassed? grabs Arnau forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What are you doing, man? Let go.

dialogues.speaker: SEASIDE INN MOTEL
dialogues.text: walks Arnau to the their motel room, forces him inside.

dialogues.speaker: SEASIDE INN MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: drags Arnau inside and literally throws him onto the bed the Goth Guy and the Decent Girl. Arnau tumbles onto the girl, who smiles with sleepy, drunk eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.  76.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hey, pillow fight! Jeff smacks the Decent Girl with a pillow, then smacks Ar then leaves the pillow with the girl. She immediately pic up the fight, playfully swatting Arnau with it. Jeff looks at the Goth Guy.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Smoke? The Goth Guy nods and follows Jeff to the door. Jeff look back as he exits. The Decent Girl throws her arms around wide-eyed Arnau an begins making out and grinding with him. Satisfied with himself, Jeff closes the door behind them. INT.
