KENNETH’S DATSUN - DAWN Darius, still snug in the towel, watches Kenneth fight shivers as he drives with the chill wind whipping in thro the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth helps Darius out of the car. She smiles at him. H drops his head shyly. Darius waves good-bye and walks awa Kenneth stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff sleeps, sitting upright in a chair placed outside th motel room door as Linsey and her friends slip out behind and silently walk away. A CELL RING. Jeff's eyes pop open. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah. INT. FACSIMILE - BRIDGETTE’S OFFICE - DAY Bridgette on the office phone.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETTE
dialogues.text: Jeff, I’ve been going over the notes you've been sending in.  77.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Jeff checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Now? It’s so early.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETTE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m working here. Isn’t that what you’re doing down there? Jeff shifts in his chair. A cheap champagne bottle slips his chest and bounces on the cement walkway.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETTE
dialogues.text: This Belinda St. Sing? The girlfriend he said died in an accident. Is that the right name?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s right. Why what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius walks through a white fog spun by the still mornin She silently passes Linsey and her friends, with pale fac and smudged mascara, moving like ghosts through the mist. Jeff clicks his cell phone shut as Darius approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You’re past curfew.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Were those girls with you?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Hundred percent Arnau. Hey, that girl your boyfriend said he’s going back to save, Belinda?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: She is alive and well. Lives a couple hours from here.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: How? What do you mean?  78.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I mean she’s alive. Bridgette called her and set an interview with her. I think your dude’s seriously nuts. Darius composes her face and makes busy with her bag.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I know he’s crazy. So she’s alive. Whatever. I want to do the interview. EXT. BELINDA’S HOUSE - DAY Darius exits the Acura. Jeff, in the driver’s seat, looks in the eye from behind dark sunglasses. Arnau sleeps in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You sure you got this, kiddo? Darius nods. EXT. BELINDA’S HOUSE - FRONT PORCH - MOMENTS LATER Darius stands on the porch of a suburban home in a lush, colorful neighborhood that contrasts the bleak pre-winter beach areas. The door finally opens. Belinda ST. SING, 30’s, a mom who’s held on to her beauty without going to extremes, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: Hi. Darius, right?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, like the Hootie and the Blowfish guy. Some SCREAMS from kids playing.

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It’ll probably be more quiet if we talk outside. EXT. BELINDA’S HOUSE - PATIO - DAY Darius sits across a patio table from Belinda.  79.

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: He worked at Anderson's, a restaurant I was waiting at during college. Really sweet. So different than any of the other guys. All of my friends were like, why are you dating this guy? But he was really fun, and funny. I remember he had all these little insecurities. He'd never let me touch his head. And he got real serious real fast, you know? I guess we’ve all had one of those guys, right? Belinda laughs. Darius swallows uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: We broke up after not long. He quit the restaurant, I didn’t see him for awhile after that. Then there was the accident.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What was the accident?

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: He crashed his car into my boyfriend’s house. It was when I first started dating Rob, my husband. He had a show in Wilmington that night, he was ina band back then. Anyways, we had a party at this little house he was renting at the time after the show. I stayed over and we went to sleep and next thing we know Kenneth crashes his car into the front lawn. Went all the way up to the house, put a dent in the wall under the kitchen window. Kenneth seemed a little drunk. I convinced Rob to let him go before the police came and we reported it as a hit and run. And now that I think of it, that’s the last time I saw him. EXT. BELINDA’S HOUSE - LATER Belinda waves as Darius makes her exit.

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: Hope I helped. It’s Facsimile Magazine?  80.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks again. Darius walks to the car, head spinning. She takes a few steps down the street before she sees the two men in black, Smith and Jones, exit their parked Sedan. Jeff gets and Jones

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Oh shit. out of his car and catches up to Darius as Smith reach her.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Can we have a moment of your time?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Nothing to be alarmed about. We'd just like to ask a few questions about Kenneth Calloway.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Look, we're just here doing a story on him. We’re not involved in anything he’s involved with.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: We don’t mean to come off the wrong way. We’ve actually talked to Facsimile magazine and verified your connection to Calloway. (off Jeff's look) You talk to people and we talk to those people. It’s our job.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What do you want with him?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We work in the private security branch of Gower MedLabs. We’ve been investigating Calloway for a couple of years now. We suspect him of being an agent working for a rival medical research company.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Why would you think him?  81.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: He’s participated in trial testing conducted by our company at a frequency that raised some internal alarm. Turns out he’s repeatedly applied for various jobs with us, all in unrelated fields.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: He can’t be a spy.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: He was arrested in Florida for breaking and entering at one of our facilities. And then there was the recent robbery at one of the testing facilities here...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What’d they take?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Prototypes for a laser hair removal system.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Technology that could be very valuable to a competing corporation. Have you had any contact with him in the past 24 hours?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No. Darius? Darius shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You know for sure he was the one who robbed the research place? Like, you have evidence?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We're confident. Give us a call if you hear from him? Smith hands Darius a card. Jones turns to leave. Smith pa

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: What’s this story about?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What’s that?  82.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: For the, for your magazine.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, the story. Time travel? I don’t know anymore, actually. He eyes them both.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Good luck. EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - DAY The Acura parks in front of Kenneth’s house. Jeff looks a Darius as she opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Darius exits the car. In the back, Arnau awakens and grog pokes his head forward.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Sex clinic, Romeo. You have a serious problem and need help. EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - PORCH - DAY Darius knocks and waits. It’s dark inside the cracked open window. She slides the window up and lifts the screen off its groove. She reache shoulder deep around to the door lock and unlocks it. INT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - DAY Gray shafts of daylight reveal the nest of an organized hoarder. Books and magazines piled neatly, edges squared eating up all of the interior space. Some mechanical devi lies in neat pieces on a blanket on the floor. Darius turns sideways to squeeze through the neat, chest- columns of clutter on her way to the computer in the corn Darius shakes the mouse and the screen saver blinks off. computer’s desktop is as cluttered as the apartment. She clicks on a few of the icons, finds nothing.  83. She turns her attention to stacks of papers on the desk. leafs through journal entries and hand-drawn designs of s component machine parts. Her eyes are drawn to a small pile of photographs on a sh She looks through photos of Kenneth at various ages...unt she stops on one photo in particular. An 8 by 10 we only the back of. This photo makes an impact on her.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH, (OS)
dialogues.text: Darius? What are you doing here? Darius shakes out of the spell and finds Kenneth there.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I just came to see what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Everything’s set. I moved the machine to the launch site. Departure is at five PM. Things are pretty hairy, I had to sneak in through the back cause the spooks are all over me. They could be out there right now. Kenneth slyly peers out through the closed blinds.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: About what happened last night. I know our working relationship became complicated but we need to re-focus and not let it compromise the mission.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No, Kenneth, I mean I talked to the guys who are following you. They said you stole those lasers to sell the technology, like you’re some corporate spy or something.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hah. Simpletons. Let them think that, it works in our favor.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I also talked to Belinda. I was at her house like an hour ago. There’s a subtle twitch in Kenneth’s expression.  84.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Wait, what? What’s going on here? You're checking up on me?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Well yeah. Most people that promise to take me on a journey through space and time I do a little research on.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I knew it. See, this whole mission is getting janked up by you.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What’s the mission? She’s alive, Kenneth. I just saw her. You lied to me about her. What else have you been lying about? EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - SAME Waiting inside the Acura, Jeff and Arnau see Jones and Sm pull the black sedan into Kenneth’s drive.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Shit. Jeff sits up and opens the car door. INT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - SAME Kenneth paces, concentrating hard.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Don’t you see? Obviously if she’s alive then I’ve already succeeded in my mission.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, just be honest with me.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: The question is why I’m not with her. What does it mean? The front door opens. Jeff spills into the room.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Darius, fuck! They’re right behind me. Jones and Smith push in right on his heels.  85.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You're with that guy?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, oh God.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You're just like the rest of them? You were making a joke of me?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No. No, I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Look, man. We’re trying to write an honest story about you for a magazine. Nobody was trying to make a joke out of you.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Jeff, don’t -

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: A magazine story? Kenneth’s face drains. His wide, hurt eyes fall on Darius

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You've been pretending? Darius?

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Kenneth Calloway, we’re taking you into custody and transporting you to Florida to stand trial. Jones and Smith step forward.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: You guys aren’t cops. You can’t come in here. They brush by Darius and close in on Kenneth.

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I have been granted power of attorney by your bail bondsman to apprehend you and deliver you to Clearwater to stand trial. Jones and Smith move to cuff him but Kenneth struggles.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: You can’t take me now! I’m leaving tonight!  86. Kenneth whips out of their grasp, knocking over towers of folded clothes and magazines, spilling onto the floor a f of junk that Jones and Smith get caught up in, dropping t Kenneth takes one last pained look at Darius and flees ou the back. Jones and Smith scramble to their feet and foll EXT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - BACK YARD - DAY Jones and Smith run into the backyard just in time to see Kenneth vanish into the thick reeds of the wilderness bey his property. They stop, hands on hips. Darius exits the house. She shuts her eyes and holds her hands to her head.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: I’m such an asshole. Jeff appears behind her.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: So was he really building a time machine or what?

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU, (0S)
dialogues.text: Hey! Check this out. It’s open. Darius looks over to the shed. The chains on the doors da freely, their locks hanging open. INT. KENNETH’S HOUSE - SHED - MOMENTS LATER Darius opens the doors, Jeff and Arnau behind her. They enter the shed, lit by sunlight filtering in through spaces between the roof and walls. It’s mostly empty. The cement floor is largely clean and bare except ina distinct pattern around the edges, suggesting something t size of a small RV recently rested here. Dozens of tools litter the floor’s edges, along with piec of tubing, pipe, gaskets, gears and circuit boards. All eyes are drawn to the walls of the shed, however. The are covered with DETAILED SCHEMATICS OF THE TIME MACHINE. From the drawing we get the sense of an airboat heavily modified with extra propeller engines and intricate machinery. It’s impressive. It looks like the real deal.  87.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Whoa, awesome.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: This is fucking fantastic. They look to Darius.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: You don’t think he really - ?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Holy shit, would he already be gone? How would we know?

dialogues.speaker: ON DARIUS
dialogues.text: Realizing she knows exactly how they'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius hurries down the hill to the base of the tree at t edge of the lake. She reaches her arm into the hollow of tree and removes the ammunition tin. She sits down on the hill with the tin on her knees as Je and Arnau approach. She opens it. There’s a note inside. Her fingers almost tremble as she reads.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: What is it? Then we hear the rumbling ROAR of engines in the distance It’s the sound of raw combustion engine mixed with the smooth, high pitched purring of electric motors. Darius stands, drops the note and follows the sound to th edge of the lake. The source quickly becomes visible. It’s incredible. A crazy, modified airboat with four propellers, multiple engines, and all kinds of tubes and cords and unidentifia parts fixed together create an intimidating piece of machinery floating in the water next to a narrow dock.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Kenneth stands on a small deck on the machine. He flips a switch.  88. Behind him a raised chassis on the machine begins spinnin circles so quickly it becomes a dangerous blur of whirlin steel.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE HILL
dialogues.text: Jones and Smith crest the hill behind them, out of breath They spot the machine and share a bewildered look.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Kenneth sees Darius as she runs onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth! Kenneth sees Darius. He eases a throttle back and the noi of the engines dies down.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Kenneth, I’m so sorry... He steps off the machine onto the dock, keeping his dista

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Were you just making a joke of me the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: No. I promise you. I lied about the story but everything else was real. That was really me. Kenneth processes this, wanting to believe her...then nod himself, resolute.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Get on.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I wasn’t going back for Belinda. I’m going back for you. I have to save your mother. Tears appear in Darius’ eyes, surprising her.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Come with me. Darius looks behind her. Jones and Smith are closing in. and Arnau watch from the shoreline.  89. Kenneth reaches out his hand. Teary-eyed but laughing, she takes it. He pulls her onto the time machine and they share a momen now face to face. Kenneth places her hand on a railing.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Hold on to this. I won’t let you get hurt. Darius nods. He returns to the controls and pushes the throttle. Lights glow and machinery spins as the noise accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Arnau picks up the fallen note as Jones and Smith walk pa Jeff watches in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: floating away from the dock, rocking wildly in the water. Kenneth holds on to the support rail with Darius. His wid eyes look upwards, hopeful, expectant. As the roaring engines reach a crescendo, we hear a loud Kenneth’s expression is invaded by doubt.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MACHINE
dialogues.text: Kenneth pushes buttons and checks gauges, his face wracke with desperation. The spinning parts are now grinding. Sm spills upwards. Darius watches Kenneth with a desperate look, hoping for something that is not possible and she knows it. Kenneth shouts at the controls, pleading and anguished. His shouts fade with the roar of the engines as the machi slowly winds down and finally becomes deathly quiet, bobb on the black water. Kenneth slumps back against the rail. All hope drains from Darius. She puts a hand on his. Jeff and Arnau watch silently and sadly from the dock as Jones and Smith ready their handcuffs.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth’s despondent face is turned down in the backseat the Sedan. He makes eye contact with Darius one last time as Jones a Smith drive him away. As the car disappears, Arnau looks at the note from Kenne still in his hand. It reads: MISSION ACCOMPLISHED.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. JEFF’S ACURA - MORNING The day’s first gasps of sunlight streak through the pass trees onto the faces of Arnau, Jeff and, finally, Darius melancholy drive out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridgette speaks to the Facsimile editorial staff.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETTE
dialogues.text: And so in light of having written a story that’s gotten the most web hits in the history of Facsimile, created an internet sensation and brought unprecedented attention to our little magazine, the least we can do is promote you to full time feature writer. As Bridgette speaks, we track across the faces in the roo all looking in one direction, to Darius, whose face we finally settle on. She forces a smile as the room APPLAUD

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGETTE
dialogues.text: Not to mention this is the first time they’ve ever sold T-shirts on the internet based on one of our stories. Bridgette unveils a joke T-shirt with a photo of Kenneth’ comically serious face next to a blown-up copy of the classified ad, above which is printed, SAFETY NOT GUARANT LAUGHS around the room. Jeff looks at Darius, who seems a thousand miles away fro the celebratory mood in the room.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius walks amongst an ocean of exhausted commuters, a f in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius rides alone, pensive, sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius sits with Mr. Britt and Farid on the couch, their faces lit by the glow of the TV.

dialogues.speaker: JAY LENO, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Wanted, somebody to go back in time with me. This is not a joke. Safety not guaranteed. I’ve only done this once before... Farid chuckles. Darius winces, angry. Mr. Britt notices t melancholy on his daughter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail end of the office party. A banner pinned along t wall reads CONGRATULATIONS DARIUS. Douchey guys surround Jeff, laughing too loud.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Meanwhile she’s like, “I want you to fuck my ass.” And I'm like, “you're the kind of girl I might fall in love with, let’s take it slow.” Jeff notices Darius drift away from the group. She passes COWORKER at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: COWORKER
dialogues.text: Hey, Darius, there’s another parody video about your mullet-man. You gotta see this, it’s hilarious. Darius moves on, ashamed to even acknowledge it.

dialogues.speaker: COWORKER, (OS)
dialogues.text: This guy’s a legend... Jeff catches up to her alone in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I had this made up for you.  92. He hands her a glass framed print of her article.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Nice writing, kid. Darius takes the frame, then casts a guilty glance toward parody video on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Jeff, I never meant to--

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I know. Arnau approaches with a short INDIAN GIRL under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ARNAU
dialogues.text: Hey, we’re cutting out early, but congrats.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS
dialogues.text: Thanks, Arnau. Bye. Arnau and Darius hug, then he leaves with his woman.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Seriously, great job. I’m proud of you. She smiles. Jeff leaves her. She looks at the framed stor Her POV pans across the article. We see the title.

dialogues.speaker: SAFETY NOT GUARANTEED
dialogues.text: Photos of Kenneth that we saw earlier in his house are patched in amongst the paragraphs. We see her face as she stops on one photo in particular: Kenneth, age five, before he ever was the butt of any jok smiling with wide, innocent eyes and just one ear. CUT TO BLACK.
